sentences.sContent: I met a tramp and gave him some money on my way home.
sentences.sContent_eng: I met a tramp and gave him some money on my way home.
sentences.sCn: 我回家的路上碰到了一个流浪汉并给了他一些钱。

sentences.sContent: Five minutes inside the soup-kitchen in Hackney, east London, and I immediately understand what Orwell meant - that the "typical tramp" does not exist.
sentences.sContent_eng: Five minutes inside the soup-kitchen in Hackney, east London, and I immediately understand what Orwell meant - that the "typical tramp" does not exist.
sentences.sCn: 在伦敦东面哈克尼的汤棚里呆了五分钟，我立刻明白了奥威尔那句“‘典型的流浪汉’不存在”是什么意思。

sentences.sContent: A tramp does not see such a meal twice in the year, in the spike or out of it.
sentences.sContent_eng: A tramp does not see such a meal twice in the year, in the spike or out of it.
sentences.sCn: 对于一个流浪汉而言，不论是在收容站还是在外面，如此丰盛的饭食他是见不到第二次的。

synos.tran: 流浪；践踏，踩；脚步沉重地行走
流浪者；沉重的脚步声；徒步旅行

trans.tranOther: someone who has no home or job and moves from place to place, often asking for food or money
